--- open-graph: true title: "Vadym Yudenko" about: template: jolla image: kotori.png links: - icon: linkedin text: Linkedin href: https://www.linkedin.com/in/vadym-yudenko/ - icon: github text: Github href: https://github.com/vyudenko - icon: file-pdf text: CV href: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1_m219XQMiiki18tZxKOvl1ICCw9h1jRe/view?usp=sharing --- ::: {.cell} ::: :::{.column-body-outset} # Experience
Institute of Behavioral Studies at American University Kyiv Junior Researcher Aug 2023 - present
::: {.callout-tip title="AUK projects" collapse="true" icon="false" style="text-align: left;"} - Evaluating [USAID AGRO](https://www.usaid.gov/ukraine/agriculture-resilience-initiative-agri-ukraine) programmes success from a behavioral perspective *(work in progress)* - Measuring the effects of mental health issues on productivity of workers *(work in progress)* ::: # Education
Kyiv School of Economics MSc of Economics Sep 2022 - Jan 2024
::: {.callout-tip title="KSE" collapse="true" icon="false" style="text-align: left;"} **Courses:** - [Statistics & Econometrics:]{.underline} - Hypothesis testing, data cleaning, data visualization with R and Tableau - Panel, cross-sectional data and difference in differences - Time series analysis and forecasting - [Behavioral Economics:]{.underline} - Researched the effects of framing on the financial decision-making of students - Studied seminal papers and latest finding of the field (Prospect Theory, Heuristics) - [Tracking Warzone Economic Activity in Ukraine (with [Duke University](https://duke.edu/)):]{.underline} - Used GoogleTrends & Nightlight data to estimate economic activity in Ukraine - Used machine learning algorithms to predict regional GDP of Ukraine Economics :::
Kyiv National Economics University BSc of Business and Management Sep 2018 - Jun 2022
::: {.callout-tip title="KNEU" collapse="true" icon="false" style="text-align: left;"} Was doing something important :) ::: # Inspiration This blog would have never been developed if not for the active community of Quarto-website aficionados, whose open-source websites helped me build one myself.
